content.question: Of the following, which identifies the aqueous solution of the compound that will have the highest <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> and explains why?

choices.label: Propylamine, because the lone pair of electrons on <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> can accept an <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math> from the solution

Pentane, because it can produce the largest number of <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>ions per molecule

2-propanol, because it can completely dissociate into <math alttext="C 3 H 7 with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>7</mn></msub><mo>+</mo></msup></math> and <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>OH</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math>

Propanoic acid, because it dissociates into <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math> and <math alttext="C 3 H 5 O 2 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>5</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup></math>

content.answer: Propylamine, because the lone pair of electrons on <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> can accept an <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math> from the solution

topic.text: 8.6: Molecular Structure of Acids and Bases

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
